page.title: 05HACKLINGE AREA FARMING
page.content: Farmland covers most of the area. Market garden crops as well as wheat and barley are grown and there is some fruit. Cattle and sheep graze the grassland whlch is also cut for silage and hay. Bullocks also graze on the marshland at Hacklinge. Twelve farms work land, the largest consists of a group of five, Betteshanger Farms, belonging to Lord Northbourne. There is one plant nursery which runs an expanding import-export business in cut flowers and pot plants, also pottery from Holland which is sent by lorry all over Britain. Marley Farm Nurseries also specialize in conifers which are sold at the nursery. In spite of the tendency towards larger fields many hedgerows remain.
